t: Amazon Wins Ruling on Results for Searches on Brands It Doesn’t Sell
s: On October 21, 2015, the Ninth Circuit ruled that online retailer Amazon does not violate the Lanham Act when, in response to a search for a brand it doesn’t sell, it returns a results page that fails to disclose that fact and simply offers competing products sold under different brands.
